Skornia: Affiliate membership needs further clarification, probably, but
this classification is available. Affiliate members have no vote but may attend
meetings and get some of the materials, although we cannot promise to send them
everything. Associate status, which I think some of you would qualify for, is
available to those educational institutions which broadcast over facilities
operated by others, whether radio or TV, educational or commercial.
INFORMAL SESSIONS
Friday Luncheon Meeting
Dr. Constance Warren, former President, Sarah Lawrence College, served as
chairman of this meeting, featuring a talk by Mr. M. S. Novik. In her introduction
Dr. Warren said:
"Mr. Novik has hitched himself to some of the most interesting people. I
prefer to sit beside him and ask him questions as he wants you all to do. He at
one time managed Clarence Darrow and Bertrand Russell, both intriguing in their own
way; he was right-hand-man to Mayor La Guardia and since that time has managed
WNYC and worked through that to the people of New York. He has been labor consul¬
tant for various organizations and is now Management Relations consultant for
the NAEB."
Mr. Novik then spoke on "A Suggested Philosophy of Educational Television Re¬
lationships with the Community." Mr. Novik*s speech was ad lib, and unfortunately
no record was made of his remarks. The meeting was then opened to questions.
